com.qualcomm.ftcrobotcontroller

Class FtcEventLoop

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.qualcomm.ftcrobotcontroller.FtcEventLoop
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.qualcomm.robotcore.eventloop.EventLoop, com.qualcomm.robotcore.util.BatteryChecker.BatteryWatcher

    public class FtcEventLoop
extends java.lang.Object
implements com.qualcomm.robotcore.eventloop.EventLoop, com.qualcomm.robotcore.util.BatteryChecker.BatteryWatcher
    Main event loop to control our demo robot

    Modify this class with your own code, or create your own event loop by implementing EventLoop.

      • init

        public void init(com.qualcomm.robotcore.eventloop.EventLoopManager eventLoopManager)
          throws com.qualcomm.robotcore.exception.RobotCoreException,
                 java.lang.InterruptedException
        Init method

        This code will run when the robot first starts up. Place any initialization code in this method.

        It is important to save a copy of the event loop manager from this method, as that is how you'll get access to the gamepad.

        If an Exception is thrown then the event loop manager will not start the robot.

        Specified by:
        init in interface com.qualcomm.robotcore.eventloop.EventLoop
        Throws:
        com.qualcomm.robotcore.exception.RobotCoreException
        java.lang.InterruptedException
        See Also:
        EventLoop.init(com.qualcomm.robotcore.eventloop.EventLoopManager)

      • loop

        public void loop()
          throws com.qualcomm.robotcore.exception.RobotCoreException
        Loop method, this will be called repeatedly while the robot is running.

        Specified by:

      • teardown

        public void teardown()
              throws com.qualcomm.robotcore.exception.RobotCoreException
        Teardown method

        This method will be called when the robot is being shut down. This method should stop the robot. There will be no more changes to write to the hardware after this method is called.

        If an exception is thrown, then the event loop manager will attempt to shut down the robot without the benefit of this method.

        Specified by:
        teardown in interface com.qualcomm.robotcore.eventloop.EventLoop
        Throws:
        com.qualcomm.robotcore.exception.RobotCoreException
        See Also:
        EventLoop.teardown()

      • processCommand

        public void processCommand(com.qualcomm.robotcore.robocol.Command command)
        If the driver station sends over a command, it will be routed to this method. You can choose what to do with this command, or you can just ignore it completely.
        Specified by:
        processCommand in interface com.qualcomm.robotcore.eventloop.EventLoop
